With a template

We can use a <template> tag to be able to “slot” in values.


  
    
      
        
          Hello World
          What's up dude
        

        
          A template in a template?!!?!?
        

        This is madness!!
      
    
  


Changing the highlight language to CSS

By default, the highlighter from Highlight.js only supports HTML / CSS / JS.
This is intentional to keep the bundle size low.


  
    
      
        html, body {
          min-height: 100%;
          height: 100%;
          padding: 0;
          margin: 0;
        }

        light-pen {
          height: 100%;
        }
      
    
  

Imports


Script

  <!-- Auto registers as <light-editor> -->
<script type="module" src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/light-pen/exports/light-editor-register.js"></script>



CDN

  <script type="module">
  // Auto registers as <light-editor>
  import "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/light-pen/exports/light-editor-register.js"

  // Manual Register
  import LightEditor from "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/light-pen/exports/light-editor.js/exports/light-editor.js"
  LightEditor.define()
  // => Registers as <light-editor>
</script>



Bundler

  // Auto registers as <light-editor>
import "light-pen/exports/light-editor.js/exports/light-editor-register.js"

// Manual Register
import LightEditor "light-pen/exports/light-editor.js/exports/light-editor.js"
LightEditor.define()
// => Registers as <light-editor>

title: <light-pen>
<light-preview>
content:
Typical Usage


  
    Displaying a super cool button

        Displaying a super cool button
      
    

    
  


Loading inline


  
    
      
        

        Displaying a super cool button not inside an iframe

        
        
          Notice how the button has the same styling as the toggle! That's because its not scoped into an iFrame!
        
      
    

    
  


Additional buttons




  
    

    
      
        Showing off more buttons
      

      HTML
      Codepen
    

    
  

  HTML
  Codepen

Imports


Script

  <!-- Auto registers as <light-preview> -->
<script type="module" src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/light-pen/exports/light-preview-register.js"></script>



CDN

  <script type="module">
  // Auto registers as <light-preview>
  import "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/light-pen/exports/light-preview-register.js"

  // Manual Register
  import LightPreview from "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/light-pen/exports/light-preview.js/exports/light-preview.js"
  LightPreview.define()
  // => Registers as <light-preview>
</script>



Bundler

  // Auto registers as <light-preview>
import "light-pen/exports/light-preview.js/exports/light-preview-register.js"

// Manual Register
import LightPreview "light-pen/exports/light-preview.js/exports/light-preview.js"
LightPreview.define()
// => Registers as <light-preview>





Attributes


  
    
      
        Name
        Description
        Reflects
        Type
        Default
      
    
    
      
  
      [Attribute]
      
      sandbox-settings
      
      [Property]
      
      sandboxSettings
  
  
    The sandbox settings to provide to the <iframe>
  
  
    
  
  
    -
  
  
    defaultSandboxSettings
  



  
      [Attribute + Property]
      
      summary
  
  
    The text to provide in the <details> toggle button
  
  
    -
  
  
    string
  
  
    "Show source code"
  



  
      [Attribute]
      
      highlight-language
      
      [Property]
      
      highlightLanguage
  
  
    The language to highlight for.
  
  
    
  
  
    string
  
  
    "html"
  



  
      [Attribute]
      
      inline-preview
      
      [Property]
      
      inlinePreview
  
  
    Set to true to not use an <iframe> for previewing
  
  
    -
  
  
    boolean
  
  
    false
  



  
      [Attribute + Property]
      
      resizing
  
  
    When the resizer is being dragged, this will be true.
  
  
    
  
  
    boolean
  
  
    false
  



  
      [Attribute]
      
      disable-highlight
      
      [Property]
      
      disableHighlight
  
  
    If disabled, its on you to provide `<pre><code></code></pre>`
  
  
    -
  
  
    boolean
  
  
    false
  



  
      [Attribute + Property]
      
      open
  
  
    Whether or not the source code is being shown
  
  
    
  
  
    boolean
  
  
    false
  



  
      [Attribute]
      
      resize-position
      
      [Property]
      
      resizePosition
  
  
    The current position of the resizer. 100 means all the way to right. 0 means all the way to left.
  
  
    
  
  
    number
  
  
    100

title: Getting Started

content: A collection of components that may not fit a design system, but that I wanted to build.

title: Index
Lightweight Components for doing complex things.
